interfaces.hil.fault_injectionÂ¶

Source: src\interfaces\hil\fault_injection.py

Module OverviewÂ¶

Fault injection system for HIL testing and validation. This module provides comprehensive fault injection capabilities including sensor faults, actuator faults, communication failures, and system-level fault scenarios for robust control system testing.

Mathematical FoundationÂ¶

Fault Injection ModelsÂ¶

Systematic fault injection for robustness testing:

\[\tilde{\vec{x}}(t) = \vec{x}(t) + \vec{f}_{\text{fault}}(t)\]

Where \(\vec{f}_{\text{fault}}\) depends on fault type and severity.

Sensor Fault ModelsÂ¶

1. Bias Fault:

\[\tilde{x}_i(t) = x_i(t) + b_i\]

2. Scaling Fault:

\[\tilde{x}_i(t) = \alpha_i x_i(t), \quad \alpha_i \neq 1\]

3. Dropout Fault:

\[\begin{split}\tilde{x}_i(t) = \begin{cases} x_i(t) & \text{with probability } 1 - p_{\text{drop}} \\ x_i(t - \tau) & \text{with probability } p_{\text{drop}} \end{cases}\end{split}\]

4. Noise Injection:

\[\tilde{x}_i(t) = x_i(t) + \eta_i(t), \quad \eta_i \sim \mathcal{N}(0, \sigma_i^2)\]

Actuator Fault ModelsÂ¶

1. Saturation Fault:

\[u_{\text{actual}} = \text{clip}(u_{\text{cmd}}, u_{\text{min}}^{\text{fault}}, u_{\text{max}}^{\text{fault}})\]

2. Delay Fault:

\[u_{\text{actual}}(t) = u_{\text{cmd}}(t - \tau_{\text{delay}})\]

3. Degradation Fault:

\[u_{\text{actual}}(t) = \beta(t) \cdot u_{\text{cmd}}(t), \quad 0 < \beta < 1\]

4. Stuck-at Fault:

\[u_{\text{actual}}(t) = u_{\text{stuck}}, \quad \forall t > t_{\text{fault}}\]

Communication Fault ModelsÂ¶

1. Packet Loss:

\[P(\text{packet received}) = 1 - p_{\text{loss}}\]

2. Latency Spike:

\[\begin{split}\tau_{\text{actual}} = \begin{cases} \tau_{\text{nominal}} & \text{with probability } 1 - p_{\text{spike}} \\ \tau_{\text{nominal}} + \Delta \tau & \text{with probability } p_{\text{spike}} \end{cases}\end{split}\]

3. Message Corruption:

\[P(\text{bit flip}) = p_{\text{corrupt}}\]

Fault Injection StrategiesÂ¶

1. Random Injection:

\[P(\text{fault at } t) = \lambda \cdot \Delta t\]

Poisson process with rate \(\lambda\).

2. Scenario-Based Injection: Deterministic fault at specific times:

\[\begin{split}\text{Fault}(t) = \begin{cases} \text{Active} & \text{if } t \in [t_{\text{start}}, t_{\text{end}}] \\ \text{Inactive} & \text{otherwise} \end{cases}\end{split}\]

3. Stress Testing: Multiple concurrent faults:

\[\vec{f}_{\text{total}} = \sum_{i=1}^{N} \alpha_i \vec{f}_i(t)\]

Fault Detection MetricsÂ¶

1. Detection Time:

\[T_{\text{detect}} = t_{\text{detected}} - t_{\text{fault}}\]

2. False Positive Rate:

\[\text{FPR} = \frac{\text{False Alarms}}{\text{Total Samples}}\]

3. False Negative Rate:

\[\text{FNR} = \frac{\text{Missed Faults}}{\text{Total Faults}}\]

Fault Severity LevelsÂ¶

Categorization:

  1. Low: \(\|\vec{f}\| < \epsilon_{\text{low}}\) (minor disturbance)

  2. Medium: \(\epsilon_{\text{low}} \leq \|\vec{f}\| < \epsilon_{\text{high}}\) (degraded performance)

  3. High: \(\|\vec{f}\| \geq \epsilon_{\text{high}}\) (critical failure)

  4. Catastrophic: System divergence or safety violation

Architecture DiagramÂ¶

graph TD A[Fault Injection Manager] --> B{Fault Type} B -->|Sensor| C[Sensor Fault Injector] B -->|Actuator| D[Actuator Fault Injector] B -->|Communication| E[Comm Fault Injector] C --> F[Add Bias] C --> G[Add Noise] C --> H[Dropout] C --> I[Scaling] D --> J[Saturation] D --> K[Delay] D --> L[Stuck-at] D --> M[Degradation] E --> N[Packet Loss] E --> O[Latency Spike] E --> P[Corruption] A --> Q[Fault Scheduler] Q --> R{Injection Time} R -->|Random| S[Poisson Process] R -->|Deterministic| T[Scenario-Based] style A fill:#9cf style Q fill:#ff9 style B fill:#f9f

Fault Injection Workflow:

  1. Configure Faults: Define type, severity, timing

  2. Schedule Injection: Random or scenario-based

  3. Apply Fault: Modify sensor/actuator/communication

  4. Monitor Response: Track detection and recovery

  5. Record Metrics: Log fault events and system response

Usage ExamplesÂ¶

Example 1: Sensor Bias FaultÂ¶

from src.interfaces.hil.fault_injection import FaultInjector, FaultType

# Create fault injector
injector = FaultInjector()

# Add sensor bias fault
injector.add_fault(
    fault_type=FaultType.SENSOR_BIAS,
    target="theta1",  # First pendulum angle
    bias=0.1,  # 0.1 radian bias
    start_time=2.0,  # Start at 2 seconds
    duration=3.0  # Last for 3 seconds
)

# Apply fault during simulation
for t in np.arange(0, 10, 0.01):
    state = plant.get_state()
    faulty_state = injector.apply(state, t)
    control = controller.compute(faulty_state)

Example 2: Actuator Saturation FaultÂ¶

from src.interfaces.hil.fault_injection import FaultInjector, FaultType

# Actuator fault
injector = FaultInjector()

injector.add_fault(
    fault_type=FaultType.ACTUATOR_SATURATION,
    target="control",
    saturation_min=-50.0,  # Reduced from -100
    saturation_max=50.0,   # Reduced from +100
    start_time=5.0
)

# Simulation with fault
for t in np.arange(0, 10, 0.01):
    state = plant.get_state()
    control = controller.compute(state)
    faulty_control = injector.apply(control, t)
    plant.step(faulty_control)

Example 3: Communication Fault (Packet Loss)Â¶

from src.interfaces.hil.fault_injection import FaultInjector, FaultType

# Packet loss fault
injector = FaultInjector()

injector.add_fault(
    fault_type=FaultType.PACKET_LOSS,
    loss_probability=0.2,  # 20% packet loss
    start_time=3.0,
    duration=5.0
)

# HIL with communication faults
for t in np.arange(0, 10, 0.01):
    # Request state from server
    state_msg = client.request_state()

    # Apply packet loss
    if injector.check_packet_loss(t):
        # Use last known state
        state = last_state
    else:
        state = state_msg.state

    control = controller.compute(state)
    client.send_control(control)
    last_state = state

Example 4: Multiple Concurrent FaultsÂ¶

from src.interfaces.hil.fault_injection import FaultInjector

# Multiple faults
injector = FaultInjector()

# Sensor noise
injector.add_fault(
    fault_type=FaultType.SENSOR_NOISE,
    target="theta1",
    noise_std=0.05,
    start_time=0.0
)

# Actuator delay
injector.add_fault(
    fault_type=FaultType.ACTUATOR_DELAY,
    delay_time=0.05,  # 50 ms delay
    start_time=4.0
)

# Communication latency spike
injector.add_fault(
    fault_type=FaultType.LATENCY_SPIKE,
    spike_probability=0.1,
    spike_duration=0.1,
    start_time=2.0
)

# Run with all faults
for t in np.arange(0, 10, 0.01):
    state = plant.get_state()
    faulty_state = injector.apply_all(state, t)
    control = controller.compute(faulty_state)
    faulty_control = injector.apply_all(control, t)
    plant.step(faulty_control)

Example 5: Fault Detection TestingÂ¶

from src.interfaces.hil.fault_injection import FaultInjector
from src.analysis.fault_detection import FDISystem

# Create fault injector and detector
injector = FaultInjector()
fdi = FDISystem(threshold=0.15)

# Inject sensor bias
injector.add_fault(
    fault_type=FaultType.SENSOR_BIAS,
    target="theta2",
    bias=0.2,
    start_time=5.0
)

# Track detection performance
detection_time = None
false_positives = 0

for t in np.arange(0, 10, 0.01):
    state = plant.get_state()
    faulty_state = injector.apply(state, t)

    # Check fault detection
    fault_detected = fdi.check(faulty_state)

    if fault_detected and detection_time is None and t >= 5.0:
        detection_time = t
        print(f"Fault detected at t={t:.2f}s (actual fault at 5.0s)")

    if fault_detected and t < 5.0:
        false_positives += 1

# Report results
print(f"Detection delay: {detection_time - 5.0:.3f}s")
print(f"False positives: {false_positives}")

  2#======================= src/interfaces/hil/fault_injection.py ========================\\\

  5"""
  6Fault injection system for HIL testing and validation.
  7This module provides comprehensive fault injection capabilities including
  8sensor faults, actuator faults, communication failures, and system-level
  9fault scenarios for robust control system testing.
 10"""
 11
 12import asyncio
 13import time
 14import random
 15import numpy as np
 16from dataclasses import dataclass, field
 17from typing import Dict, Any, Optional, List, Callable, Union
 18from enum import Enum
 19import logging
 20
 21
 22class FaultType(Enum):
 23    """Fault type enumeration."""
 24    SENSOR_BIAS = "sensor_bias"
 25    SENSOR_DRIFT = "sensor_drift"
 26    SENSOR_NOISE = "sensor_noise"
 27    SENSOR_STUCK = "sensor_stuck"
 28    SENSOR_DROPOUT = "sensor_dropout"
 29    ACTUATOR_BIAS = "actuator_bias"
 30    ACTUATOR_STUCK = "actuator_stuck"
 31    ACTUATOR_SATURATION = "actuator_saturation"
 32    ACTUATOR_DEADBAND = "actuator_deadband"
 33    COMMUNICATION_DELAY = "communication_delay"
 34    COMMUNICATION_LOSS = "communication_loss"
 35    COMMUNICATION_CORRUPTION = "communication_corruption"
 36    POWER_SUPPLY_DROP = "power_supply_drop"
 37    SYSTEM_OVERLOAD = "system_overload"
 38
 39
 40class FaultSeverity(Enum):
 41    """Fault severity enumeration."""
 42    LOW = "low"
 43    MEDIUM = "medium"
 44    HIGH = "high"
 45    CRITICAL = "critical"
 46
 47
 48@dataclass
 49class FaultProfile:
 50    """Fault injection profile configuration."""
 51    fault_type: FaultType
 52    severity: FaultSeverity
 53    target_device: str
 54    target_channel: Optional[str] = None
 55
 56    # Timing parameters
 57    start_time: float = 0.0
 58    duration: Optional[float] = None
 59    intermittent: bool = False
 60    intermittent_period: float = 1.0
 61
 62    # Fault parameters
 63    magnitude: float = 1.0
 64    offset: float = 0.0
 65    noise_level: float = 0.1
 66    pattern: str = "constant"  # constant, ramp, sine, random
 67
 68    # Recovery parameters
 69    recoverable: bool = True
 70    recovery_time: Optional[float] = None
 71
 72    # Conditional parameters
 73    conditions: Dict[str, Any] = field(default_factory=dict)
 74
 75
 76@dataclass
 77class FaultScenario:
 78    """Complete fault scenario with multiple fault profiles."""
 79    name: str
 80    description: str
 81    profiles: List[FaultProfile] = field(default_factory=list)
 82    scenario_duration: Optional[float] = None
 83    repeat_count: int = 1
 84    randomize_timing: bool = False
 85    timing_variation: float = 0.1
 86
 87
 88@dataclass
 89class FaultEvent:
 90    """Fault event record."""
 91    timestamp: float
 92    fault_id: str
 93    event_type: str  # "inject", "remove", "modify"
 94    fault_type: FaultType
 95    target_device: str
 96    target_channel: Optional[str]
 97    magnitude: float
 98    success: bool = True
 99    error_message: Optional[str] = None
100
101
102class FaultInjector:
103    """
104    Comprehensive fault injection system for HIL testing.
105
106    Provides systematic fault injection capabilities for sensors,
107    actuators, communication, and system-level components to validate
108    control system robustness and fault tolerance.
109    """
110
111    def __init__(self, device_manager: 'DeviceManager',
112                 communication_interfaces: Dict[str, Any]):
113        """Initialize fault injector."""
114        self._device_manager = device_manager
115        self._communication_interfaces = communication_interfaces
116
117        # Active faults tracking
118        self._active_faults: Dict[str, FaultProfile] = {}
119        self._fault_tasks: Dict[str, asyncio.Task] = {}
120        self._fault_history: List[FaultEvent] = []
121
122        # Fault scenarios
123        self._scenarios: Dict[str, FaultScenario] = {}
124        self._active_scenario: Optional[FaultScenario] = None
125        self._scenario_task: Optional[asyncio.Task] = None
126
127        # Configuration
128        self._logger = logging.getLogger("fault_injector")
129        self._enabled = True
130        self._safety_limits = {}
131
132        # Statistics
133        self._stats = {
134            'total_faults_injected': 0,
135            'active_faults': 0,
136            'scenarios_executed': 0,
137            'fault_types_used': set()
138        }
139
140    @property
141    def enabled(self) -> bool:
142        """Check if fault injection is enabled."""
143        return self._enabled
144
145    @property
146    def active_faults(self) -> Dict[str, FaultProfile]:
147        """Get currently active faults."""
148        return self._active_faults.copy()
149
150    @property
151    def statistics(self) -> Dict[str, Any]:
152        """Get fault injection statistics."""
153        stats = self._stats
154        stats['fault_types_used'] = list(stats['fault_types_used'])
155        return stats
156
157    def enable(self) -> None:
158        """Enable fault injection."""
159        self._enabled = True
160        self._logger.info("Fault injection enabled")
161
162    def disable(self) -> None:
163        """Disable fault injection."""
164        self._enabled = False
165        self._logger.info("Fault injection disabled")
166
167    async def inject_fault(self, fault_id: str, profile: FaultProfile) -> bool:
168        """Inject a specific fault."""
169        try:
170            if not self._enabled:
171                self._logger.warning("Fault injection is disabled")
172                return False
173
174            if fault_id in self._active_faults:
175                self._logger.warning(f"Fault {fault_id} already active")
176                return False
177
178            # Validate fault profile
179            if not await self._validate_fault_profile(profile):
180                return False
181
182            # Start fault injection
183            self._active_faults[fault_id] = profile
184            self._fault_tasks[fault_id] = asyncio.create_task(
185                self._execute_fault(fault_id, profile)
186            )
187
188            # Record event
189            event = FaultEvent(
190                timestamp=time.time(),
191                fault_id=fault_id,
192                event_type="inject",
193                fault_type=profile.fault_type,
194                target_device=profile.target_device,
195                target_channel=profile.target_channel,
196                magnitude=profile.magnitude
197            )
198            self._record_fault_event(event)
199
200            self._logger.info(f"Injected fault {fault_id}: {profile.fault_type.value}")
201            return True
202
203        except Exception as e:
204            self._logger.error(f"Failed to inject fault {fault_id}: {e}")
205            return False
206
207    async def remove_fault(self, fault_id: str) -> bool:
208        """Remove an active fault."""
209        try:
210            if fault_id not in self._active_faults:
211                self._logger.warning(f"Fault {fault_id} not active")
212                return False
213
214            # Cancel fault task
215            if fault_id in self._fault_tasks:
216                self._fault_tasks[fault_id].cancel()
217                try:
218                    await self._fault_tasks[fault_id]
219                except asyncio.CancelledError:
220                    pass
221                del self._fault_tasks[fault_id]
222
223            # Remove from active faults
224            profile = self._active_faults.pop(fault_id)
225
226            # Record event
227            event = FaultEvent(
228                timestamp=time.time(),
229                fault_id=fault_id,
230                event_type="remove",
231                fault_type=profile.fault_type,
232                target_device=profile.target_device,
233                target_channel=profile.target_channel,
234                magnitude=0.0
235            )
236            self._record_fault_event(event)
237
238            self._logger.info(f"Removed fault {fault_id}")
239            return True
240
241        except Exception as e:
242            self._logger.error(f"Failed to remove fault {fault_id}: {e}")
243            return False

329    async def _execute_fault(self, fault_id: str, profile: FaultProfile) -> None:
330        """Execute fault injection task."""
331        try:
332            # Wait for start time
333            if profile.start_time > 0:
334                await asyncio.sleep(profile.start_time)
335
336            start_time = time.time()
337            device = self._device_manager.get_device(profile.target_device)
338
339            if not device:
340                raise Exception(f"Device {profile.target_device} not found")
341
342            while True:
343                # Apply fault based on type
344                await self._apply_fault(device, profile)
345
346                # Check duration
347                if profile.duration and (time.time() - start_time) >= profile.duration:
348                    break
349
350                # Handle intermittent faults
351                if profile.intermittent:
352                    await asyncio.sleep(profile.intermittent_period)
353                else:
354                    await asyncio.sleep(0.1)  # Small delay to prevent busy waiting
355
356        except asyncio.CancelledError:
357            # Clean up fault
358            await self._cleanup_fault(fault_id, profile)
359            raise
360        except Exception as e:
361            self._logger.error(f"Error in fault execution {fault_id}: {e}")
362            # Record failed event
363            event = FaultEvent(
364                timestamp=time.time(),
365                fault_id=fault_id,
366                event_type="error",
367                fault_type=profile.fault_type,
368                target_device=profile.target_device,
369                target_channel=profile.target_channel,
370                magnitude=profile.magnitude,
371                success=False,
372                error_message=str(e)
373            )
374            self._record_fault_event(event)
375
376    async def _apply_fault(self, device: 'DeviceDriver', profile: FaultProfile) -> None:
377        """Apply specific fault to device."""
378        try:
379            if profile.fault_type == FaultType.SENSOR_BIAS:
380                await self._apply_sensor_bias(device, profile)
381            elif profile.fault_type == FaultType.SENSOR_DRIFT:
382                await self._apply_sensor_drift(device, profile)
383            elif profile.fault_type == FaultType.SENSOR_NOISE:
384                await self._apply_sensor_noise(device, profile)
385            elif profile.fault_type == FaultType.SENSOR_STUCK:
386                await self._apply_sensor_stuck(device, profile)
387            elif profile.fault_type == FaultType.ACTUATOR_BIAS:
388                await self._apply_actuator_bias(device, profile)
389            elif profile.fault_type == FaultType.ACTUATOR_STUCK:
390                await self._apply_actuator_stuck(device, profile)
391            elif profile.fault_type == FaultType.COMMUNICATION_DELAY:
392                await self._apply_communication_delay(profile)
393            elif profile.fault_type == FaultType.COMMUNICATION_LOSS:
394                await self._apply_communication_loss(profile)
395            else:
396                self._logger.warning(f"Unsupported fault type: {profile.fault_type}")
397
398        except Exception as e:
399            self._logger.error(f"Failed to apply fault {profile.fault_type}: {e}")

450    async def _execute_scenario_task(self, scenario: FaultScenario) -> None:
451        """Execute complete fault scenario."""
452        try:
453            self._logger.info(f"Executing scenario: {scenario.name}")
454
455            for repeat in range(scenario.repeat_count):
456                if repeat > 0:
457                    self._logger.info(f"Scenario repeat {repeat + 1}/{scenario.repeat_count}")
458
459                # Schedule all fault profiles
460                fault_tasks = []
461                for i, profile in enumerate(scenario.profiles):
462                    fault_id = f"{scenario.name}_fault_{i}_{repeat}"
463
464                    # Add timing variation if enabled
465                    if scenario.randomize_timing:
466                        variation = random.uniform(-scenario.timing_variation,
467                                                 scenario.timing_variation)
468                        profile.start_time += variation
469
470                    # Start fault injection
471                    task = asyncio.create_task(
472                        self._inject_scenario_fault(fault_id, profile)
473                    )
474                    fault_tasks.append(task)
475
476                # Wait for scenario completion
477                if scenario.scenario_duration:
478                    await asyncio.sleep(scenario.scenario_duration)
479                else:
480                    # Wait for all faults to complete
481                    await asyncio.gather(*fault_tasks, return_exceptions=True)
482
483                # Clear faults between repeats
484                if repeat < scenario.repeat_count - 1:
485                    await self.clear_all_faults()
486                    await asyncio.sleep(1.0)  # Brief pause between repeats
487
488            self._stats['scenarios_executed'] += 1
489            self._logger.info(f"Completed scenario: {scenario.name}")
490
491        except asyncio.CancelledError:
492            self._logger.info(f"Scenario {scenario.name} cancelled")
493            await self.clear_all_faults()
494            raise
495        except Exception as e:
496            self._logger.error(f"Error executing scenario {scenario.name}: {e}")
497
498    async def _inject_scenario_fault(self, fault_id: str, profile: FaultProfile) -> None:
499        """Inject fault as part of scenario."""
500        await self.inject_fault(fault_id, profile)
501
502        # Wait for fault completion
503        if fault_id in self._fault_tasks:
504            try:
505                await self._fault_tasks[fault_id]
506            except asyncio.CancelledError:
507                pass
508
509    async def _validate_fault_profile(self, profile: FaultProfile) -> bool:
510        """Validate fault profile configuration."""
511        # Check if target device exists
512        device = self._device_manager.get_device(profile.target_device)
513        if not device:
514            self._logger.error(f"Target device {profile.target_device} not found")
515            return False
516
517        # Check safety limits
518        if profile.target_device in self._safety_limits:
519            limits = self._safety_limits[profile.target_device]
520            if profile.magnitude > limits.get('max_magnitude', float('inf')):
521                self._logger.error(f"Fault magnitude exceeds safety limits")
522                return False
523
524        return True
525

529            # Remove fault modifications

531            if device:
532                # Device-specific cleanup would be implemented here
533                pass
534
535            self._logger.debug(f"Cleaned up fault {fault_id}")

540    def _record_fault_event(self, event: FaultEvent) -> None:
541        """Record fault event in history."""
542        self._fault_history.append(event)
543
544        # Update statistics
545        if event.event_type == "inject":
546            self._stats['total_faults_injected'] += 1
547            self._stats['fault_types_used'].add(event.fault_type.value)
548
549        self._stats['active_faults'] = len(self._active_faults)
550
551        # Limit history size
552        if len(self._fault_history) > 10000:
553            self._fault_history = self._fault_history[-5000:]

561# Utility functions for common fault scenarios
562def create_sensor_fault_scenario(sensor_name: str, fault_types: List[FaultType],
563                                duration: float = 60.0) -> FaultScenario:
564    """Create common sensor fault scenario."""
565    profiles = []
566    start_offset = 0.0
567
568    for fault_type in fault_types:
569        profile = FaultProfile(
570            fault_type=fault_type,
571            severity=FaultSeverity.MEDIUM,
572            target_device=sensor_name,
573            start_time=start_offset,
574            duration=duration / len(fault_types),
575            magnitude=0.1 if "noise" in fault_type.value else 1.0
576        )
577        profiles.append(profile)
578        start_offset += duration / len(fault_types)
579
580    return FaultScenario(
581        name=f"{sensor_name}_fault_sequence",
582        description=f"Sequential fault injection for {sensor_name}",
583        profiles=profiles,
584        scenario_duration=duration
585    )

 66    async def inject_fault(self, fault_id: str, profile: FaultProfile) -> bool:
 67        """Inject a specific fault."""
 68        try:
 69            if not self._enabled:
 70                self._logger.warning("Fault injection is disabled")
 71                return False
 72
 73            if fault_id in self._active_faults:
 74                self._logger.warning(f"Fault {fault_id} already active")

 78            if not await self._validate_fault_profile(profile):

 82            self._active_faults[fault_id] = profile

 84                self._execute_fault(fault_id, profile)
 85            )

 87            # Record event
 88            event = FaultEvent(
 89                timestamp=time.time(),
 90                fault_id=fault_id,
 91                event_type="inject",
 92                fault_type=profile.fault_type,
 93                target_device=profile.target_device,
 94                target_channel=profile.target_channel,
 95                magnitude=profile.magnitude
 96            )
 97            self._record_fault_event(event)
 98
 99            self._logger.info(f"Injected fault {fault_id}: {profile.fault_type.value}")
100            return True

103            self._logger.error(f"Failed to inject fault {fault_id}: {e}")

219
220        if since:
221            history = [event for event in history if event.timestamp >= since]
222
223        if fault_type:
224            history = [event for event in history if event.fault_type == fault_type]
225
226        return history
227
228    async def _execute_fault(self, fault_id: str, profile: FaultProfile) -> None:
229        """Execute fault injection task."""
230        try:
231            # Wait for start time
232            if profile.start_time > 0:
233                await asyncio.sleep(profile.start_time)
234
235            start_time = time.time()
236            device = self._device_manager.get_device(profile.target_device)
237
238            if not device:
239                raise Exception(f"Device {profile.target_device} not found")
240
241            while True:
242                # Apply fault based on type
243                await self._apply_fault(device, profile)
244
245                # Check duration
246                if profile.duration and (time.time() - start_time) >= profile.duration:
247                    break
248
249                # Handle intermittent faults
250                if profile.intermittent:
251                    await asyncio.sleep(profile.intermittent_period)
252                else:
253                    await asyncio.sleep(0.1)  # Small delay to prevent busy waiting
254
255        except asyncio.CancelledError:
256            # Clean up fault
257            await self._cleanup_fault(fault_id, profile)
258            raise
259        except Exception as e:
260            self._logger.error(f"Error in fault execution {fault_id}: {e}")
261            # Record failed event
262            event = FaultEvent(
263                timestamp=time.time(),
264                fault_id=fault_id,
265                event_type="error",
266                fault_type=profile.fault_type,
267                target_device=profile.target_device,
268                target_channel=profile.target_channel,
269                magnitude=profile.magnitude,
270                success=False,
271                error_message=str(e)
272            )
273            self._record_fault_event(event)
274
275    async def _apply_fault(self, device: 'DeviceDriver', profile: FaultProfile) -> None:
276        """Apply specific fault to device."""
277        try:
278            if profile.fault_type == FaultType.SENSOR_BIAS:
279                await self._apply_sensor_bias(device, profile)
280            elif profile.fault_type == FaultType.SENSOR_DRIFT:
281                await self._apply_sensor_drift(device, profile)
282            elif profile.fault_type == FaultType.SENSOR_NOISE:
283                await self._apply_sensor_noise(device, profile)
284            elif profile.fault_type == FaultType.SENSOR_STUCK:
285                await self._apply_sensor_stuck(device, profile)
286            elif profile.fault_type == FaultType.ACTUATOR_BIAS:
287                await self._apply_actuator_bias(device, profile)
288            elif profile.fault_type == FaultType.ACTUATOR_STUCK:
289                await self._apply_actuator_stuck(device, profile)
290            elif profile.fault_type == FaultType.COMMUNICATION_DELAY:
291                await self._apply_communication_delay(profile)
292            elif profile.fault_type == FaultType.COMMUNICATION_LOSS:
293                await self._apply_communication_loss(profile)
294            else:
295                self._logger.warning(f"Unsupported fault type: {profile.fault_type}")
296
297        except Exception as e:
298            self._logger.error(f"Failed to apply fault {profile.fault_type}: {e}")
299

349    async def _execute_scenario_task(self, scenario: FaultScenario) -> None:
350        """Execute complete fault scenario."""
351        try:
352            self._logger.info(f"Executing scenario: {scenario.name}")
353
354            for repeat in range(scenario.repeat_count):
355                if repeat > 0:
356                    self._logger.info(f"Scenario repeat {repeat + 1}/{scenario.repeat_count}")
357
358                # Schedule all fault profiles
359                fault_tasks = []
360                for i, profile in enumerate(scenario.profiles):
361                    fault_id = f"{scenario.name}_fault_{i}_{repeat}"
362
363                    # Add timing variation if enabled
364                    if scenario.randomize_timing:
365                        variation = random.uniform(-scenario.timing_variation,
366                                                 scenario.timing_variation)
367                        profile.start_time += variation
368
369                    # Start fault injection
370                    task = asyncio.create_task(
371                        self._inject_scenario_fault(fault_id, profile)
372                    )
373                    fault_tasks.append(task)
374
375                # Wait for scenario completion
376                if scenario.scenario_duration:
377                    await asyncio.sleep(scenario.scenario_duration)
378                else:
379                    # Wait for all faults to complete
380                    await asyncio.gather(*fault_tasks, return_exceptions=True)
381
382                # Clear faults between repeats
383                if repeat < scenario.repeat_count - 1:
384                    await self.clear_all_faults()
385                    await asyncio.sleep(1.0)  # Brief pause between repeats
386
387            self._stats['scenarios_executed'] += 1
388            self._logger.info(f"Completed scenario: {scenario.name}")
389
390        except asyncio.CancelledError:
391            self._logger.info(f"Scenario {scenario.name} cancelled")
392            await self.clear_all_faults()
393            raise
394        except Exception as e:
395            self._logger.error(f"Error executing scenario {scenario.name}: {e}")
396
397    async def _inject_scenario_fault(self, fault_id: str, profile: FaultProfile) -> None:
398        """Inject fault as part of scenario."""
399        await self.inject_fault(fault_id, profile)
400
401        # Wait for fault completion
402        if fault_id in self._fault_tasks:
403            try:
404                await self._fault_tasks[fault_id]
405            except asyncio.CancelledError:
406                pass
407
408    async def _validate_fault_profile(self, profile: FaultProfile) -> bool:
409        """Validate fault profile configuration."""
410        # Check if target device exists
411        device = self._device_manager.get_device(profile.target_device)
412        if not device:
413            self._logger.error(f"Target device {profile.target_device} not found")
414            return False
415
416        # Check safety limits
417        if profile.target_device in self._safety_limits:
418            limits = self._safety_limits[profile.target_device]
419            if profile.magnitude > limits.get('max_magnitude', float('inf')):
420                self._logger.error(f"Fault magnitude exceeds safety limits")
421                return False
422
423        return True
424

426        """Clean up fault after completion or cancellation."""
427        try:
428            # Remove fault modifications
429            device = self._device_manager.get_device(profile.target_device)
430            if device:
431                # Device-specific cleanup would be implemented here
432                pass
433
434            self._logger.debug(f"Cleaned up fault {fault_id}")
435
436        except Exception as e:
437            self._logger.error(f"Error cleaning up fault {fault_id}: {e}")
438
439    def _record_fault_event(self, event: FaultEvent) -> None:
440        """Record fault event in history."""
441        self._fault_history.append(event)
442
443        # Update statistics
444        if event.event_type == "inject":
445            self._stats['total_faults_injected'] += 1
446            self._stats['fault_types_used'].add(event.fault_type.value)
447
448        self._stats['active_faults'] = len(self._active_faults)
449
450        # Limit history size
451        if len(self._fault_history) > 10000:
452            self._fault_history = self._fault_history[-5000:]
453
454    def set_safety_limits(self, device_id: str, limits: Dict[str, Any]) -> None:
455        """Set safety limits for fault injection."""
456        self._safety_limits[device_id] = limits
457        self._logger.info(f"Set safety limits for device {device_id}")

 1def create_sensor_fault_scenario(sensor_name: str, fault_types: List[FaultType],
 2                                duration: float = 60.0) -> FaultScenario:
 3    """Create common sensor fault scenario."""
 4    profiles = []
 5    start_offset = 0.0
 6
 7    for fault_type in fault_types:
 8        profile = FaultProfile(
 9            fault_type=fault_type,
10            severity=FaultSeverity.MEDIUM,
11            target_device=sensor_name,
12            start_time=start_offset,
13            duration=duration / len(fault_types),
14            magnitude=0.1 if "noise" in fault_type.value else 1.0
15        )
16        profiles.append(profile)
17        start_offset += duration / len(fault_types)
18
19    return FaultScenario(
20        name=f"{sensor_name}_fault_sequence",
21        description=f"Sequential fault injection for {sensor_name}",
22        profiles=profiles,
23        scenario_duration=duration
24    )
